Title: By the Rivers of Babylon

Verses.1:
There, by the rivers of Babylon, we sat down and wept [*]
	when we remembered Zion.
Verses.2:
Upon and within the willows [*]
	we hung up our harps.
Verses.3:
For it was there our captors [*]
	demanded songs from us.
There our tormentors asked for joyful songs, [*]
	"Sing us one of the songs of Zion!"
Verses.4:
How do we sing the LORD's song [*]
	in a foreign land?
Verses.5:
If I forget you, Jerusalem, [*]
	let my right hand forget me.
Verses.6:
Let my tongue stick to the roof of my mouth, [*]
	if I do not remember you,
if I do not exalt Jerusalem [*]
	above my greatest joy.

Changes: 2023-10-14 - Paul Prins: First translation based on Greek, Latin, and some Hebrew.
